Children can be acceptable missionaries in the home and in the church. God would have them taught that they are in this world for useful service, not merely for play. They can be trained to do missionary work that will prepare them to fill wider spheres of usefulness. Ms 138, 1903, pp. 1, 2, 4. (To "My Dear Brethren and Sisters Everywhere," "How We Can Help the Southern Work," November 17, 1903.) 

White Estate Washington, D.C.
